alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 12:53PM PST until February 24 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches, with local amounts up to 24 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County, this includes Tennant. For the Winter Weather Advisory, portions of Highway 97. * WHEN...From 4 PM Thursday to 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates Thursday night could approach 1 to 2 inches per hour in the warning area. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County
